meta.name: copyright

div.span:
Welcome to the North Dickinson County School web-page. It is my sincere hope that students will have a successful and rewarding school experience. The community, staff and Board of Education has provided our students with many opportunities to grow accademically, socially, and physically. Our school staff is made up of many caring and dedicated people who will work very hard to give the best educational experience possible. In return, we ask our students to put forth their best effort in all of their classes and get involved in school activities.
If there is any way I can help you during the school year, please be sure to ask; my door is always open.
Sincerely,
Mrs. Angel R. Inglese
Superintedent/Principal

Mission Statement:
North Dickinson County School, as a reflection of a caring, unique community located in a natural setting, will empower and challenge all students to achieve their fullest intellectual potential, character, and attitudes to create better lives for themselves and the larger community.
Nordic Athletics:
North Dickinson offers several sports for both boys and girls at the high school level including football, volleyball, basketball, and track & field. The Nordics compete in the Skyline Central Conference with other area schools
Technology:
Through the use of advanced technology, we are able to provide students with modern resources, and offer students a range of classes that extend beyond the walls of our building to offer students a more fulfilling and challenging educational experience.

div.p:
From Mrs. Inglese
Thank you for being patient in this time of confusion. Our teachers are working very hard to put together a plan for each of their classes to get us through until the end of the academic year. We are required to submit our plan to the ISD which will include how our teachers are intending to educate your child. Each teacher is willing to accommodate your children to ensure that education is provided for all. As part of our educational plan, we have to make the make many assurances that we will make every effort to educate our students. Our expectation is that our students will be “up and running” academically April 13 or 14 either with online content or packets sent home. This newsletter is serving as our notification to pupils and parents of our educational plan. Please read each individual teacher plan as it applies to your child so you are aware of what is expected for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year.
Please help to hold your child accountable for the work that is sent home during this time. As you will see, many of the teachers in grades 4 through 11 will be relying on technology. If your child does not have the ability to access the internet, each teacher is making a separate lesson plan and will have packets to send home to your child. Many of the teachers wrote in their newsletter articles that parents will have to come get their children’s text books. We will be sending out our buses on Tuesday, April 14, 2020 for their afternoon route. The bus will contain student locker/desk contents as well as materials needed for students to work from home. We are asking the parents to meet the bus (not your child) and pick up your Nordic’s materials. If you are unable to, please call the school to schedule a time to pick it up. The buses will run their regular evening route so please be on time at the bus stop. If you receive textbooks from your teacher it will be expected that they are returned at the beginning of the 2020-2021 school year.
The teachers are following the following guidelines for instructional time:

div.p:
At this time, we are unsure what is going on with our senior students. As we get more information we will be in touch with seniors and their parents. We ask the seniors to check their Nordic email regularly for updates. If you were in good academic standing as of March 13, 2020 Governor Whitmer figures that you are finished for the year and will obtain credit for your classes. However, we strongly encourage you to continue with your work as you prepare for your postsecondary career. If you are taking a dual enrollment course you will absolutely have to finish these courses. If you are a senior that was struggling with academics at that time you will have to do quarter 4 work to earn credit for the semester. These students will be contacted individually.
Please feel free to call the District office if you have questions after reading this newsletter. I cannot promise that we will have all the answers, but we will do our best to find the answers to your questions. All of the staff at ND misses our Nordics and cannot wait for this to be over so we can see our students again. Please ask your kids to sing Row the Boat to you (they should all know it by now) 143 Nordics!

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

br.br: This November four of our school board member’s terms expire. If you are interested in running for the school board please contact the Dickinson County clerk for specific information on the procedure to run, not your local municipal clerk. The reason for this is because our school district crosses several different political jurisdictions. If you have questions regarding serving as a Board member, please contact the District Office. You must either file nominating petitions or pay a $100.00 fee and you must complete and file an Affidavit of Identity. The deadline for all paperwork must be completed and submitted no later than July 21, 2020 at 4:00 p.m. You pick up and then file all completed paperwork with the County Clerk office that is located in the Dickinson County Courthouse.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;
p.br:
By: Michael Roell, Business Manager
The North Dickinson School District will have a request for millage on the August 4, 2020 election. The millage request will ask the tax payers to consider a 1 mill tax increase for 3 years for the purchase of school buses, acquiring and installing instructional technology and instructional technology equipment and re-equipping the school building. The district again plans to reduce the levy on the 2 mill sinking fund to 1 mill for the 3-year period to keep the property taxes in check.
Elementary Special Education~ Mrs. Hord
I have sent home reading intervention packets for my elementary students. Being that these interventions are at your child's current reading level and different for each student, I decided to send home the level they are currently at as well as the next two levels. There should be enough in these packets to keep your child reading even through the summer. These are supplemental materials to help increase reading fluency, accuracy and comprehension. Your child's classwork from their general education teacher should come first. As I stated in the letter I sent with the packets, these are designed to do one short story a week and can be completed in just 5-10 minutes per day. Please email me at ahord@go-nordics.com or send me a text letting me know that your child received their packet. I would also like to hear from you if their packet did not come. Feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns regarding their general education work as well. We are all in this together and I am willing to help you any way that I can.
Kindergarten
Mr. Christian’s will be sending packets home every two weeks. He will also be working on developing an online learning program. Once he has this complete he will be contacting parents to let them know how to access this information.
First Grade
It has been nice to keep in touch with you first graders! Keep calling, texting, emailing and writing letters. I will continue to send home work for you every two weeks. Your reading stories are on AR. I will send home your logins in your next packet. We will be covering measurement and fractions soon in math, so be on the lookout for some fun activities to do at home! If your parents have any questions, they can contact me at any time. Remember to get some exercise every day, build or draw something and also be helpful to your parents. We can get through this together!
143 Mrs. Mattson
Second Grade
I will be sending your desk contents home including your reading and mathematics books on the bus on Tuesday. If you are not on a bus route, please contact the school to pick up these materials. When you get your books, there will be a letter from me laying out my expectations for 2 weeks. Please follow the guidelines closely. Every 2 weeks you can expect to get a new set of expectations in the mail. Please keep a log of your activities and have your parents email me the log every 2 weeks. My email address is aunamattson@go-nordics.com. I miss all of you and hope you are all staying healthy. I can’t wait to see you and introduce you to Esther when we can return to the school building.
Third Grade
The third grade will be continuing education using a variety of methods. I have gathered books for each student that buses will be delivering on the afternoon bus route on Tuesday, April 14th, if you are unable to pick them up at the bus route please call the school to schedule a time to pick them up. I am sending a packet home that will include a letter explaining things better. The letter will also have a username and password for each student to log in to think central. If you have any questions or do not receive the packet please contact me via phone, text, or email. My phone number is 906-282-6775 and my email is agrunlund@go-nordics.com.
Fourth Grade
The fourth-grade students will be receiving a letter in the mail. It will include their email username and password. I have also set up accounts for each student to utilize Think Central which is an on-line version of our Reading and Math curriculum. I will be providing detail instructions and lessons every two weeks. Please make sure your child is checking their Nordic email. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact me at vjohnson@go-nordics.com
Be safe and stay healthy,
Mrs. Johnson

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

div.p:
Dear Nordic 5th grade students and Parents,
I’m writing to talk a little bit about what my plan is with continuing instruction throughout the remainder of the school year. As you probably have heard we’ve been informed by Governor Whitmer we are required to give guidelines for students in the state to continue some type of curriculum to finish out the 2019-2020 school year. For 5th grade, I have chosen to use the online program called Kahn Academy. I have chosen content, which we would have focused on, had we been able to return to school. I also believe it to be a program which the students can navigate with little to no assistance from parents, as I understand you have to work and take care of your families.
I have set up our class with a class code so you can see the assignments I have assigned. I will attempt to provide 2 weeks of curriculum at a time. Since this is new to me, I’m hoping I don’t give too much. Under the guidelines set forth by our state, our expectation is that you will work on each core subject (math, history, language arts, and science) for approximately 15 minutes per day, which will equate to 60 minutes per day. Understand that when you first open up my classroom, it will look like a ton of assignments, but many are a 2-5 minute video at times, but shows up as an assignment. Also, they are from all 4 core subject areas. Much of what you will do is listen/watch videos of instruction, then a couple questions related to what you’ve watched. Please, with some of the other time of the day, get about 15-20 minutes of some sort of exercise or activity with your families. If students are super motivated, they are most certainly able to complete as much as they would like. Everyone will be at a different pace. This too, allows flexibility within families, because as we all understand, life happens.
This type of teaching/learning is very new to many, including me. I’m sure there will be some difficulties along the way. I will be of assistance in any way that I can. Parents, I too want to extent my gratitude to you at this time, while you are trying to balance your everyday life, while at the same time assisting your child with their education. I have included my email as well as my phone number if you need so I can try to help to the best of my ability. I will check my email periodically and return suggestions ASAP. Again, thank you for your patience.
Phone 906-221-6768
Email mlindholm@go-nordics.com
Khan Academy class codes:
(JE9Z94WR for US History 5, 4GJ3EYTJ for Science 5, P6CY549F for Math, C4HAQZK5 for Language Arts 5)
Thanks for Listening,
Michael Lindholm
Mr. Faust’s Classes
6th and 7th Grade Geography- Eastern Hemisphere textbooks will be delivered on the afternoon bus route on Tuesday, April 14th, if you are unable to pick them up at the bus route please call the school to schedule a time to pick them up. They should also check their e-mail for instructions regarding assignments and setting up an online Edmodo Learning Account where they can access information and submit assignments.
8th Grade History- Students should check their email to join my Khan Academy Classroom which will pick up from where we stopped to the end of what needs to be covered. They should also check their e-mail for instructions regarding assignments and setting up an online Edmodo Learning Account where they can access information and submit assignments.
8th Grade Health/Physical Ed.- Students should check their e-mail for instructions regarding assignments and setting up an online Edmodo Learning Account where they can access information and submit assignments.
H.S. Novel and Cinema As History- Please call the office to set up a time to pick up the three Novels, if you cannot meet the bus, that they need to read and complete assignments about. The three novels are Code Talkers, Harriet Tubman: Freedom Leader, and Narrative of the Live of Fredrick Douglass. They should also check their e-mail for instructions to set up an online Edmodo Learning Account where they can access information and submit assignments.
H.S. Critical Issues Class- Students need to check their e-mail for instructions regarding assignments and accessing their online Edmodo Learning Account where they can access information and submit assignments.
Please feel free to contact me during the day to address questions or concerns that you may have. I will also be making calls to check in on students during the week.
Mrs. Christian Classes
Mrs. Christian will be developing her classes through Khan Academy. Once she has each of her classes set up she will be sending each student an email with the information they will need to access their class information. For any student that doesn’t have access to their email or technology she will be sending packets home.
Ms. Anderson Classes
Hi everyone! I miss all of you and hope you are doing fine. I’ve been busy setting up cool websites for us to explore in elementary music, band and ELA. If you didn’t take your instrument home, please contact me at landerson@go-nordics.com and we’ll make arrangements for you to pick it up or for it to go home on the bus Tuesday. If you don’t have internet, I will be sending packets to you with materials. More information will be sent to you on how to connect to our websites. I’m looking forward to hearing from you! Ms. Anderson
Mr. Siegler Classes
WHAT TO EXPECT!!!
6th and 8th grade Math
I have created a website that will allow you to have a guided schedule throughout the remainder of the school year. This schedule will be updated every two weeks with the new material. Students are to spend NO MORE than 30 minutes daily on their math assignments with a minimum time recommended of 15 minutes. Our math classes will primarily be run using KAHN academy. We have used KAHN throughout the year (more with 8th grade), so students should have a username and password. If students do not remember their username and password, they are able to create an account at: https://www.khanacademy.org/
6th Grade Class Code: KNGPCN3U
8th Grade Class Code: 5FY6EX4T
On my website mrsigmath.weebly.com (which you can navigate to by going to our Nordic website, click on staff directories, then click on my name) you find the weekly lesson plans. This will give the outline of the suggested schedule. I will update assignments on KAHN and the website every two weeks to progress through the material. If you have questions and/or concerns please feel free to email me at gsiegler@go-nordics.com.
Stay Safe, Stay Healthy, Row The Boat, 143.
Mrs. Lindholm
First of all, let me start off by saying this is not something that we ever thought would happen in our lifetime but it did. Now, we as Nordics, need to pull through the next 7 weeks to get through quarter four. I want to do the best job I can for my students and there may be times of frustration and panic on both sides of the computer. That’s okay, we will get through this and we will move on. If parents need to contact me please send me an email at vlindholm@go-nordics.com I will be checking my email daily.
Now that we have expectations from the state, we will be able to progress effectively with some type of schedule for classes. It is important for the parent and child to set up sometime of learning schedule throughout the week. This will hopefully help both parent and child obtain the learning goals for each class.
English 9 and 10th grades will be focusing on curriculum content for the 4th quarter. Our main reading will be the Odyssey by the blind poet Homer. Students will be using the website Epic to access their reading information on-line. Students who do not have access to the internet will have their English textbook. Parents will need to pick up their students required work at the school’s scheduled time, if they can’t pick it off from the bus. Students will also be focusing on writing through NoRedInk along with grammar assignments. This program is to help students write journals that are content specific with a focus on Common Core writing skills. Students will be needing their access code for both programs. They will be sent to students through their email or Remind app. Students need to be checking their emails weekly for English work and updates. English should be done at least 20-30 minutes a day which would be 100-150 minutes a week for the next seven weeks. Students/parents can decide how they want to spread these learning minutes throughout the week.
English 11 Since the SAT has been postponed to the fall of 2020 it is important that students in 11th grade keep up with their English reading, grammar, and writing skills. We will be using Khan Academy for the next 7 weeks to make sure we do not lose what we already know and to increase our knowledge on these key elements for SAT testing. Juniors have been using Khan Academy this past year so all juniors are familiar with this program. Khan Academy has multiple videos, questions and practice tests for the English portion of the SAT. Juniors should be on Khan Academy at least 20-30 minutes a day which would be 100-150 minutes a week. Students/parents can decide how they want to spread these learning minutes throughout the week. Students will need to make sure they have the access code that is connected to Mrs. Lindholm’s English Classroom. Khan Academy keeps track of how much time a student spends doing the assignments and reports back to the teacher how the student did on specific elements. These skills are then reported to Mrs. Lindholm so she knows what needs to be worked on when classes resume in the fall. Students who do not have access to Khan Academy will have packets sent home to them.
Digital Imaging Students will be given weekly photography and reading assignments for the next seven weeks. They need to be checking their emails for their weekly assignments every Monday. Students who do not have access to their email or internet will have homework sent home to them. I also sent a Remind sign up in your emails so students can send me their photos from their phone to me.
7th Grade Elective Students will be given bi-weekly projects for the next seven weeks. Each project will focus on learning new skills, recording their learning steps and submitting final project. Students will be able to send me their project assignments by email, Remind or journal. Students will need to check their emails for the Remind sign up instructions. Students should be spending at least 15-20 minutes a day on their projects.
Mr. Murray’s MATH and EXPLORATORY
Hello students and parents! I hope this letter finds you well. We trudge on with learning however we can. It may not be as enjoyable as being in the same room with your ageing, balding, and particular math teacher but we’ll manage I think. Because the internet will be our best means of connecting we will be using Khan Academy for the remainder of the school year. Some students already have accounts and are already part of my classes, but many of you aren’t. Below are directions for students/parents to follow to create an account on Khan Academy.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

div.p:
For step 2 Mr. Murray’s specific class codes are as follow:
1st hr Geometry: SGC2G2D5
2nd hr Math 7: UTCZZXKX
3rd hr Algebra1: QCAKWVPT
4th hr PreCalc: YHPJ9R9D
5th hr Algebra 2: TNYD7T63
6th hr Explore 8: EVPA5KRP
For step 3, I would prefer that students use their school issued (@go-nordics.com) email address. If issues arise with usernames and passwords being forgotten, the school can help students regain access (parents please email Mrs. Lindholm with student email issues: vlindholm@go-nordics.com).
For step 4, please enter the grade you are currently in (8th grade students in algebra 1 should still select 8th grade.) You have to select a course to continue, so just pick the one that sounds most like the class you’re joining (Exploratory 8 students can select “computer animation”). I will assign work to students so the course you select is mostly irrelevant.
Once your account is created, I can then assign work to you. We will be starting on Monday April 13th, so the sooner you can join my class the better. I’ll be checking my email and Khan Academy accounts each morning of the school week to check in with all of you and make sure you’re on track. It’s okay if you don’t work on math every day, but pay attention to the assignment due dates.
For those of you who don’t have internet access, you’ll be receiving correspondence from the school via mail.
Geometry students, for Quarter 3 your report card will say “I” for incomplete. You need to create a tessellating tile, trace it on a piece of paper and color it. You may use the one that you started in class if you have it, or you may start over. What I need to see is a picture of your tessellation, either with your signature in the corner or with your wonderful face in the picture. Please send those to my email and I can update your quarter 3 grades as I get them.
Sincerely, Mr. Murray amurray@go-nordics.com

br.br:
Hello Nordics, I hope everyone is well. We are going to have to do our best to try to finish up the school-year at home. I have put together my plan for science and shop and will share it for all my students via student email or remind. I have set up group email lists for all my classes and will post lessons here. (I combined both 6th hr. and 7th hr. shop classes into one group.) I have also included codes for students and parents to sign up to my Remind App. I will also provide information for students to sign up to Khan Academy for Science 9, Biology, Chemistry, and Physics.
Parents of students who will not be utilizing Khan Academy we will be delivering students books on the afternoon bus route on Tuesday, April 14th, if you are unable to pick them up at the bus route please call the school to schedule a time to pick them up. Weekly lessons from text books and/or Khan Academy will be provided the following ways:
1- Pick up weekly lesson plans at school office each Monday (for textbook users)
2- Student Nordic E-mail
3- Remind App
Students’ completed work from textbooks will need to be dropped off at the school office when completed. Parents should drop off completed work when picking up the next week’s lesson. Students who are using Khan Academy will be assessed by their teacher as they progress throughout their lessons.
Codes for accessing Mr. Mattson’s Khan Academy Classes----first log into www.khanacademy.org/join (Please sign up as soon as possible.)
1- Science 9 CK98VVT3
2- Biology HA65V4XF
3- Chemistry P2875FXQ
4- Physics HN3K7DXA
Codes for accessing Mr. Mattson’s Remind App Classes (Please sign up as soon as possible.)
Smart Phone Text Notification
1- Science 9 rmd.at/ndsci9 @ndsci9 to 81010
2- Biology rmd.at/ndbiolol @ndbiolol to 81010
3- Chemistry rmd.at/ndchemistry @ndchemistry to 81010
4- Physics rmd.at/ndphysic @ndphysics to 81010
5- Shop rmd.at/ndshop @ndshop to 81010
I know this is not to best of circumstances, and it will be quite clumsy at first, but we will get through this. Students (and parents) don’t stress yourselves sick! If anyone has questions, use Remind or email me at cmattson@go-nordics.com. Thanks, and stay healthy!

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;
p.strong: Mr. Cousineau – Nordic High School Social Studies and Personal Fitness

br.br:
Dear Parents and Students,
Hope you are doing well!
Following is the format I will be following for my content area classes: Economics, History, World History and Personal Finance
For each of the above I am setting up a curriculum to follow on Khan Academy. Students will be notified/invited via email (go-nordics account). Students will join the class and have access to the course material.
I will assign material each week for students to work on. I will check their progress regularly and be available to answer questions.
For students who do not have access to technology, I will assign work from our textbook. We will be sending out our buses on Tuesday, April 14, 2020 for their afternoon route so parents can pickup textbooks at that time.
How to join your teacher’s Khan Academy class
1 Go to khanacademy.org/join
2 Enter your class code and press “Add”. Class code: (sent in email to student)
3 If you don’t already have an account, press “Create a new account”. Enter your date of birth, then sign up using Google, your school email, or by creating a username.
4 Enter your grade and course. Now you’re ready to start learning!
Personal Fitness/Physical Education
For Personal Fitness I will be recommending workouts that are on YouTube and/or send kids fitness task cards to complete. I will have students log their workouts and send them to me, and also have them send evidence of other workouts they have completed. ~Be Safe, T. Cousineau
Mrs. Jungwirth-Student Services
Online Courses and Michigan Virtual High School
Students are expected to continue their online learning courses through Michigan Virtual High School and Edmentum. Mrs. Jauquet and Mrs. Jungwirth will continue to monitor student progress on student courses through the remainder of the school year. If a student needs an exam password or is having difficulties, they should reach out to their online instructor first and then e-mail Mrs. Jauquet and Mrs. Jungwirth. It is extremely important that we know if you are having technical difficulties right away so we can help you get them fixed. While there is a pacing guide, the virtual courses are self-paced so students may complete courses ahead of schedule. Mrs. Jauquet’s e-mail address is jauquet@go-nordics.com and Mrs. Jungwirth’s e-mail is ajungwirth@go-nordics.com
Senior Scholarships

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;
p.br:
If senior students have scholarships at home, they should mail them directly to the scholarship selection committee. Mrs. Jungwirth has been and will continue to, use e-mail to communicate with students about any changes regarding scholarship applications and deadlines. Students should reach out to Mrs. Jungwirth if they need a scholarship application e-mailed to them. If students are unsure where to send the scholarships they should reach out to Mrs. Jungwirth through e-mail at ajungwirth@go-nordics.com
Scheduling

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;
p.br:
Students in grades 8th-11th will get an e-mail from Mrs. Jungwirth within the next 2 weeks to select courses for scheduling. It is important that students respond to this e-mail in order to get their first choice of course they want. If students/parents have questions regarding scheduling they can e-mail Mrs. Jungwirth with questions or email her to set up a time to talk over the phone.
Dual Enrollment

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;
p.br: An e-mail was sent out to all 10th and 11th grade students regarding steps for dual enrollment. Registration is now open, so students should start the registration process ASAP. Mrs. Jungwirth will set up a Zoom meeting if there is interest to inform students and parents of the dual enrollment process and classes that students should consider taking. Please reach out to Mrs. Jungwirth through e-mail if you are interested in attending a Zoom meeting and/or if you want more information at ajungwirth@go-nordics.com

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;

br.br:
Last week, as I was debating how I was going to get through the last couple of months of school without students being in the building, I allowed myself to have a day filled with sadness. I was sad imaging not seeing my Nordic family every day and sad thinking about all that we would miss out on as the year goes by. I was sad for my own children and for your children. As I lay awake that night unable to sleep, I was reminded of a canvas I have hanging in my office that says: Grant me the SERENITY to accept the things I cannot change, COURAGE to change the things I can, and the WISDOM to know the difference. I took a deep breath, let go of the sadness, and reminded myself that during this time of change and of uncertainty it is even more important to focus on the things that we can control and change.
With that being said, I know that this is a very challenging time for everyone and I want you to know we are all here for you and your family. There have been so many changes happening in the world and in our children’s world and it is a lot to take in. Please know that as the school counselor, I am here for you and so is the rest of our Nordic staff. As a staff, I know that this situation has made all of us have a greater appreciation for each other and for our students. We terribly miss seeing your kids every day.
While we are not in school I am available to meet virtually or over the phone with your child if they are struggling with any emotional/mental health issues or if they have questions about school or college and career counseling. Please contact me first through e-mail and we can set up a date and time that works for both us. If your child was meeting with a staff member from the ISD and you feel like they need a check-in from that person, please call the school and we can have the ISD staff member contact you. Even if your child doesn’t seem to be struggling, but you feel like they would benefit from a phone call or virtual meeting please reach out to us! Not all students feel comfortable with me but they may have another favorite teacher or staff member. If you contact me or Mrs. Inglese, one of us will make sure that we have that staff member reach out to your child.
Many of our students and adults are feeling extra stress and anxiety so I have included some simple tips/techniques on the next page that can be used to help. Our students learned some of the techniques during our mental health awareness day at school. Getting daily exercise by taking a walk is an easy way to reduce stress and anxiety. I have also included some very simple mindfulness practices, and different breathing techniques and you can find many more by doing a quick Google search. I encourage you to practice the techniques with your child and go through them together. During times of change, it is important to acknowledge the many feelings that come along with those changes and work through those feelings together.
Even though we are all separated in the physical sense, it is important that you and your children know that you are not alone. Our Nordic staff is here for you. During this time, my hope is that each of your families is able to use the extra time at home to grow closer together and that it helps you find a greater appreciation for life and for each other. Please reach out to me if you need anything through e-mail at ajungwirth@go-nordics.com or by phone at 906-221-5446. In the meantime, your families are in my thoughts and prayers every day. Row the boat Nordics!
143, Mrs. Jungwirth
Parent Survey

p.span: arents/guardians we need your help! We know that helping students do their best in school requires a team effort. To help all of us learn how to make your child's schooling experience as positive and beneficial as possible, please give us your honest, thoughtful responses to the questions in the survey on the link below. Please copy the access code listed below for the grade level of your oldest child and then click the link to complete the survey! Thank you!

div.p:
Dear Parents, Students and Staff:
As many of you are aware, Governor Whitmer Announced Statewide Closure of All K-12 School Buildings from Monday, March 16 through Sunday, April 5. With that being said, North Dickinson County School will be closing its doors to all students, staff and community members effective Friday, March 13, 2020 at 4:00 PM. The only staff members allowed in the school buildings will have pre-approved permission from Mrs. Inglese.
The North Dickinson School District will be offering pre-packaged breakfast and lunch for our students during the three week break. In order to take advantage of this opportunity we expect parents to call the school by 12:00 PM on Monday, March 16, 2020 to inform the District that you are interested. Parents that contact the school will be expected to pick up their food between noon and 1:00 PM on the following dates:
Tuesday, March 17, 2020
Friday, March 20, 2020
Monday, March 30, 2020
As mentioned above, the food will be available for pick up only. We will not be able to deliver meals to families. The Tuesday pick up will contain breakfast and lunch for Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. The Friday pick up will contain breakfast and lunch for the week of spring Break and the Monday pick up will contain breakfast and lunch for the week of March 30.
If you have any questions regarding this communication, please contact the school Monday March 16, 2020. There are many uncertainties during this time and there are many questions that we do not yet have answers to. We can assure you, that as we know more we will make information available on the school website and through Power Announcement.
Sincerely,
Angel R. Inglese
North Dickinson Alumni Scholarship
Abigail Reimer, a 2014 graduate of North Dickinson and a 2019 graduate of Northern Michigan University has decided to start an alumni scholarship at North Dickinson. Abigail said the following about why she is starting this scholarship:
“I want to pay it forward for all the scholarships I received as a graduating high school student. Without the scholarships I received I would not have been able to complete my goal of getting my bachelor degree without any college debt. I feel the best way of thanking the people who awarded me scholarships is to start one for my high school alma mater.”
This year, Abigail is funding one scholarship for a 2020 graduate of North Dickinson, but her hope is that other alumni will be inspired by her generosity and consider donating to the scholarship fund. She shared that her dream is to be able to award 3-4 scholarships each year to Nordic graduates. If you are able to donate to the scholarship fund, please contact Angie Jungwirth at ajungwirth@go-nordics.com or call the school at 542-9281. Any amount you are willing and able to donate is appreciated and no amount is too small. Checks should be made out to North Dickinson Alumni Scholarship. Funds received will be deposited into the scholarship account at school and will be used to help Abigail reach her admirable goal of supporting as many North Dickinson students as possible.

North Dickinson County School
W6588 M69
Felch, MI 49831
Phone: 906.542.9281 - Fax: 906.542.6950
